thread.title: The Remarkable American Who Died While Rescuing ISIS Hostages
thread.title_full: The Remarkable American Who Died While Rescuing ISIS Hostages

author: Grizz1
title: The Remarkable American Who Died While Rescuing ISIS Hostages
text: Posts: 1,209 The Remarkable American Who Died While Rescuing ISIS Hostages Master Sergeant Joshua Wheeler of Roland, Oklahoma was advising a group of peshmerga commandos when he heard them come under attack inside an Islamic State prison. Even though he wasnt supposed to engage the enemy, this highly decorated, 39 year old father of 4 ran to the sound of the guns, according to Defense Secretary Carter Ash. His actions saved his unit, but cost him his own life. The picture emerging of Sgt. Wheelers performance in combat shows he acted in the best traditions of the United States armed services while disregarding his own safety to save his teammates. Location: Lenexa, Kansas Posts: 29,690 How would you like to have a dude like that staring at you from the other side of a gun barrel? Talent on loan from god Quote: Originally Posted by Grizz1 Master Sergeant Joshua Wheeler of Roland, Oklahoma was advising a group of peshmerga commandos when he heard them come under attack inside an Islamic State prison. Even though he wasnt supposed to engage the enemy, this highly decorated, 39 year old father of 4 ran to the sound of the guns, according to Defense Secretary Carter Ash. His actions saved his unit, but cost him his own life. The picture emerging of Sgt. Wheelers performance in combat shows he acted in the best traditions of the United States armed services while disregarding his own safety to save his teammates. He ran to the sound of the guns | PJ Tatler So much for Obama's "No boots on the ground" shit. (My bold) You use another American death for political purposes. You are despicable. I have no respect for a sick creep like you.
